intro: Mafekingia parquetiana, commonly known as the yellow mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant attaches itself to the branches of its host trees, drawing water and nutrients through its haustoria. It produces small, fleshy berries that are dispersed by birds. Due to its parasitic nature and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
